main event: A single white light object was observed in the sky near Brookville, Ohio on May 6, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared as a small light much brighter than the surrounding stars.
The object disappeared suddenly after being observed for about 5 minutes.
The sky conditions were described as full moonlight with very clear stars.
The observer estimated the object would have been completely covered by a match held at arm's length.
No sound was reported from the object.
sighted object: a single bright white light in the sky
